CountryData.name: Mayotte
CountryData.description: Mayotte is an autonomous region of France located in the Indian Ocean, about 650 kilometers east of Madagascar. It’s a volcanic island with a unique blend of African, Arab, and French cultures. The island boasts stunning coral reefs, lush rainforests, and diverse wildlife, making it a popular destination for ecotourism and adventure travel.  Its economy relies heavily on agriculture, fishing, and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Mayotte.
quickFacts.detail: Mamoudzou is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the island.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population is a diverse mix of ethnicities.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 60% are Comorian, 30% are Mahoran, and 10% are French.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small island with varied terrain.
quickFacts.detail: It consists of Grande Comore, Ngazidja, and Mwali.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: As part of France, Mayotte uses the Euro.
quickFacts.detail: However, Comorian francs are also widely accepted.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Comorian and Mahoran are also spoken.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A developing economy primarily based on agriculture and tourism.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism is a growing sector, attracting visitors with its pristine beaches and unique culture.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Mayotte experiences a tropical climate with consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the wet season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season offers lower humidity and fewer rain showers, making it ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall and occasional cyclones, but also lush vegetation and vibrant landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is characterized by the hottest temperatures and most intense sunshine.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Ntengwe
naturalWonders.description: Mount Ntengwe is the highest point on Mayotte, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the island and surrounding waters. It’s a challenging but rewarding hike for experienced trekkers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The ascent involves navigating through dense rainforest and volcanic terrain. The summit provides a stunning vista of the island's diverse landscapes, including the turquoise coastline and the lush interior.
viewingTips: Start early to avoid the midday heat
Bring plenty of water and sunscreen

naturalWonders.name: Iha Mtsapéré Coral Reef
naturalWonders.description: Iha Mtsapéré is a vibrant coral reef system teeming with marine life, offering exceptional diving and snorkeling opportunities. Its diverse coral formations and abundant fish species make it a true underwater paradise.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reef is home to a wide variety of coral species, including staghorn coral, brain coral, and soft corals. It’s also a habitat for numerous fish species, including colorful reef fish, sea turtles, and sharks.

ecosystemData.title: Mayotte Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Mayotte’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from volcanic mountains and rainforests to coral reefs and coastal wetlands. The island’s unique location and isolation have contributed to the evolution of endemic species and a rich biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Mayotte is a haven for migratory birds, with a diverse range of species visiting the island during the breeding season.

notableSpecies.name: Mayotte Paradise Flycatcher
notableSpecies.significance: Critically important for the island's avian biodiversity

notableSpecies.name: Red-tailed Tropicbird
notableSpecies.significance: A rare visitor to the island

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Life
biodiversityCategories.description: The coral reefs surrounding Mayotte are home to an incredible array of marine life, including colorful fish, sea turtles, sharks, and dolphins.

notableSpecies.name: Green Sea Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the reef ecosystem

notableSpecies.name: Hammerhead Shark
notableSpecies.significance: Occasional sightings in the surrounding waters

activities.title: Mayotte Adventures
activities.description: Mayotte offers a wide range of activities for adventure seekers and nature lovers, from hiking and diving to exploring waterfalls and discovering local culture.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island's volcanic mountains and lush rainforests on foot.

activities.name: Ntengwe Summit Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Mount Ntengwe, offering stunning views.

activities.name: Waterfall Trek
activities.description: Discover hidden waterfalls in the island's interior.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of Mayotte with a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Discover the underwater world without diving.
